Direct Known Subclasses:
FAddNoise, FAddPoint, FAddSegment, FBinarize, FBlobs, FBrightness, FCalcHistoBD, FCalcHistoColor, FCanny, FCleanOmnidir, FClousure, FColorToGray, FCompareDistances, FContrast, FConvol3x3, FConvol5x5, FConvolveAscii, FConvolveImage, FCountCoins, FCrop, FDilate, FDivideBlobs, FEqualize, FErode, FFlip, FFlow, FFuzzyKMeans, FGabor, FGamma, FGeoToGray, FGrad, FGrayToColor, FGrayToGray, FGroupImages, FHistoCirc, FHistogram, FHistoKMeans, FHoughCirc, FHoughLine, FInterpBi, FInterSegment, FKmeans, FLearnLT, FLevelThresholding, FLink, FLoadImage, FMag, FManhattan, FMaximum, FMinimum, FMirror, FNegate, FNitzberg, FOp, FOpening, FOpenWindow, FPca, FPcaNewCoordinates, FPcaRecognition, FPhase, FPixelate, FRandomPoint, FRandomSegment, FRecogLT, FRectifyOmnidir, FRGBToColor, FRingCreateMask, FRotate, FScale, FSearchImage, FSegEdges, FSegmentHSB, FSharpen, FSift, FSkeleton, FSkew, FSmooth, FSmoothGaussian, FSOM, FSusan, FWaveHoriz, FWaveVert
public abstract class JIPFunction
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Class to define function objects. A function is used to process an image (sequence) and to return an image (sequence). A function can have some additional parameters (input and/or output). Parameters can be get or set by name. Moreover, a function has a name and a description of what it does to the input image. This class is abstract, so a function must implement this class.

See Also:
Serialized Form

processImg

public abstract JIPImage processImg(JIPImage img)
                             throws JIPException
Gets an output image from a input image. This method must be implemented and contains the core of the function.

Parameters:
img - Input image.
Returns:
Output image.
Throws:
JIPException

processSeq

public JIPSequence processSeq(JIPSequence seq)
                       throws JIPException
This is the default behavior when processing a sequence: every image in the sequence is processed when the processImg method. Thus, the result is a sequence with the same number of images than the input sequence. Every image in the new sequence is the result of applying the processImg method. This method can be overloaded if we wish to process the sequence in a different way.

Parameters:
seq - Input sequence.
Returns:
Output sequence.
Throws:
JIPException

paramsOK

public boolean paramsOK()
It checks if every function the required parameters have an assigned value.

Returns:
true if every function required parameter have some assigned value. or if the function does not have parameters. Else return false.
